oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rules and Regulations for Pardon Applications

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Large broadside giving details concerning the method for convicts in the state prison to use in applying for a pardon. The broadside is signed by Governor John C. Brown.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Prisons; Prisoners; Sentences (Criminal procedures); Governors
Broadsides; Brown, John C. (John Calvin), 1827-1889
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John Calvin Brown, Confederate general and governor, was born in Giles County on January 6, 1827. After the Civil War, Brown resumed his Pulaski law practice. President of the 1870 Constitutional Convention, Brown was elected Tennessee's nineteenth governor after voters adopted the new constitution; he was reelected in 1872. Formerly a Whig, Brown joined the Democrats and was leader of the party's Bourbon faction. He died in 1889.
